Season, era end with loss

After holding the lead for most of last night's Game 7, the Boston Celtics were overpowered by LeBron James and the Miami Heat, and had no answer for Chris Bosh in the fourth quarter.

In drill, Waltham simulates train crash

This morning Waltham's police and fire departments simulated a dramatic accident involving a car, tractor trailer, and commuter rail train. (Globe, 12:05 p.m.)

Taunton endorses tribe's casino plan

City voters supported a proposed Mashpee Wampanoag tribal casino in the first ballot-box victory in Mass. for gambling since the state legalized casinos. (Boston Globe)
  • Taunton backers outspend opponents | Casinos in Mass.

In a world of super PACs, Romney rules

No candidate in the 2012 race adapted more swiftly and effectively to super PACs than Mitt Romney, and a group of his former top aides has become a force for him. (Globe)

In Mass., young putting homes on hold

As overall homeownership went up, the number of 25-to-34-year-olds owning homes in-state dropped 20 percent from 2005 and 2010, according to the US census. (Globe)

If Celtics coach Doc Rivers had his way, everyone would be back. But he knows better than anyone else that management has broader concerns.

There are nagging fears among residents that a Suffolk Downs casino might upset a tenuous balance and knock an up-and-coming community off stride.
